title: GEODE-5748: Hold clearRegion write lock during cleanUpAfterFailedGII
body:
* To avoid race with concurrent cache operation, a clearRegion write lock is needed
   when clearing entries and disk region entries during cleanUpAfterFailedGII, as cache
   operations hold clearRegion read lock.

title: GEODE-5747: Handling SocketException in InternalDataSerializer
body:
A SocketException has to be caught because we want to continue trying to connect to locators rather than shutdown the gateway sender event processor.  The SocketException appears to arise due to a temporary network connectivity issue when reading off the socket.  We already handle an unexpected EOF here, so we should most likely be handling the SocketException in the same way.

-------------------------------------------

title: GEODE-5741: Modified tests to be independant of environment
body:
Tests using relative paths had depended on running as a user other than root.
The tests expected that file or directory creation would fail because the user
would not have permission to write to '/'.

A further problem was the several tests had hard-coded '/' in pathnames,
which is incompatible with running on Windows.

title: GEODE-5605: After removeAll/PutAll messages are processed on replicas, check for cache close is done.
body:
An in-flight operation may not be seen by the new GII requester if the GII provider cache closes. This happens when there are more than one replica for the region.
The change checks for cache close after replicating the data; if cache is closed, throws exception back to the accessor/caller, which will retry the operation. This causes the operations are applied on all the present nodes.

title: GEODE-5734: allow extensibility of Docker build mounts.
body:
If a user wants to extend Gradle's Docker plugin with their own tests,
setting dunitDockerVolumes to some value, then that value will be
overridden in docker.gradle. For better extensibility, do not set this
property if it is already set.

body:

where the code was giving bad feedback, but to address the impressive structural duplication.

Things done:

-Split out a base class so there was no inheritance of test classes to do basic things.

title: GEODE-5499: move awaitility into invoked runnable
body:
Assertion errors within invoked runnables get wrapped in an
RMIException, so untilAsserted does not recognize them as failed
assertions. Since they are treated as unexpected errors, awaitility
does not loop.  Moving the awaitility inside the invocation gives us the
expected behavior.

Signed-off-by: Dale Emery<demery@pivotal.io>

body:
* GEODE-3900: Use TemporaryFolder for all disk dirs and files
* Remove use of base class
* Ensure Cache and DS have proper tearDown
* Use Rules, Awaitility, and AssertJ
* Use CountDownLatch instead of verbose synchronization tricks
* Minimize usage of non-User APIs
* Fix usage of deprecated APIs
* Use proper variable names
* Extract testCompactorClose to DiskRegionCompactorCloseIntegrationTest
* Extract testDiskRegDWAttrbts to DiskRegionAttributesIntegrationTest

I'd like to get this merged in before doing any further cleanup or renaming of DiskRegionJUnitTest. Please see GEODE-5721 for further cleanup. I'm happy to add more tasks to that if review digs up more things to change.

title: GEODE-5700: Removed stopping cache server explicitly
body:
There is a race condition where a member volunteers for primary at the same time the rest of the servers are shutting down.  This causes an error level log due to trying to access a cache servers IP that was not running.  We could make a change to the product, but it looks like we intentionally wanted to log non cache-cancelled exceptions (?)

The cache server is explicitly shutdown first in the ServerStarterRule close method.  I can't think of a reason why we would want to do this because cache.close() will also shut down the cache servers.

title: GEODE-5649 getAll() does not trigger client metadata refresh when pri
body:
mary bucket not known

If the primary for a bucket was not known when creating one-hop tasks we
were not scheduling a metadata refresh.

These changes initiate a refresh but allow the current operation to
continue as a non-single-hop operation.

title: GEODE-5657: Build job now behaves like test job.
body:
* Build now provisions an external worker, similar to other testing
jobs.
* Add execute_build.sh, to be combined with existing execute_tests.sh in
GEODE-5659.
* Increase verbosity during testing
* Correct issue with extra newline in Jinja templating of pipelines
* Introduce a shared_utilities.sh for bash functions
* Multiple whitespace adjustments
* Build artifacts are now tar'd in archive_results.sh
* * This is achieved with the test env parameter
TAR_GEODE_BUILD_ARTIFACTS
* Remove block for sending build-success email, as this is never done

------

The spin-out of `shared_utilities.sh` helped to understand the script during iteration.  However, as it stands, the utility of that file is not, in fact, shared.  It wasn't clear to me whether or not it improves readability within the script or if it just adds one more place for a developer to look for a function definition.  Your thoughts and comments on this would be appreciated.

----

***Please note:*** Due to resource constraints, this should not be merged before #2396.

----

title: GEODE-5652: use unlimited ThreadPoolExecutor in ExecutorServiceRule
body:
This changes the ExecutorServiceRule to use an unlimited ThreadPoolExecutor.

Improve or fixup a couple tests that use the ExecutorServiceRule:
* PartitionedRegionCreationDUnitTest
* DLockServiceLeakTest
* InterruptDiskJUnitTest (major overhaul)

This PR depends on PR #2405 (GEODE-5662: improve timeouts in ExecutorServiceRuleTest) which deleted two flaky tests from ExecutorServiceRuleTest because the tests were primarily testing ExecutorService instead of the rule itself.

title: GEODE-5645 Client cache misses invalidate
body:
Notify clients/gateways on an invalidation that is overwriting an
existing invalidated entry.  This allows them to update their version
information in case there is an operation that conflicts with this
invalidation and should be thrown away.

title: GEODE-4650: Refactor Elder selection
body:
* add distributed test for elder
* Extract the ClusterElderManager from ClusterDistributionManager and
delegate
* add unit test for ClusterElderManager
* test how elder is chosen to reproduce GEODE-4650
* remove caching of elder. This avoids an issue where in some cases, the
cached value could be set to a member that has left the cluster, causing
the DLockService to hang.
* remove the tryLock used to retry in getElderState. tryLock was
leftover and unnecessary after removing CollaborationLock.
